intro: Chthamalia schaffneri, commonly known as the Schaffner's sea lettuce, is a species of green algae belonging to the family Ulvaceae. It is characterized by its thin, blade-like structure and is typically found in intertidal zones along rocky shores. This plant thrives in marine environments, often forming dense mats on submerged or partially submerged surfaces. Its simple morphology and rapid growth make it an important component of coastal ecosystems. Chthamalia schaffneri plays a role in providing habitat and food for various marine organisms.
